720084f.text:
Grand Street, at the S.E. corner of Chrystie Street. Shown is the east side store of Lord & Taylor's (wholesale and retail merchants).
This store was maintained from 1853 to 1902.
About 1885.
720084f.folder: Grand Street & Chrystie Street, Manhattan, NY

718825f-a.text:
105-109 Chrystie Street, west side, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Grand Street. No 107 is a frame building.
April 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

733091f-a.title: Social conditions - Bread lines [for the unemployed and needy.]
733091f-a.text:
(1)
A bread-line for the unemployed and needy, during the period of the depression. This distribution center is at Grand and Chrystie Streets.
January 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The saame, a closer view.
January 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
733091f-a.folder: Grand Street and Chrystie Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

720083f-a.text:
(1)  Grand Street, north side, east from and including the Bowery, to Chrystie Street. Also shown is Chrystie Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Grand Street. No. 250 Grand Street, at the N.W. corner of Chrystie Street, and No. 109 Chrystie Street, north of the N.W. corner of Grand Street, are 3-story frame buildings. Also a 3-story frame building is No. 244 Grand Street,
north side, west from Chrystie Street.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 380.
(2)
The same, from a different angle, showing a farther view.
November 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
720083f-a.folder: Grand Street & Chrystie Street, Manhattan, NY
